page.title: 11Farming no.l
page.content: This is predominantly a farming area and many people who do not actually own or rent a farm are employed by the local farmers,though the increased use of tractors and other machinery means that fewer people are employed, even during the harvest and hop-picking seasons. Although this was once a thriving hop growing area, only three farms grow them now. Most farms grow apples which are sold to well known Herefordshire cider makers, while three farms specialise in soft fruit - blackcurrants, raspberries, and strawberries. One farmer grows daffodils commercially.
